recipes.title: Tuna Mayo Don
method: Mix the tuna, mayo, wasabi, and soy sauce in a bowl.
Slice the avocado and place in a bowl on top of rice.
Add the tuna mayo mixture and garnish with the chopped green onion, shichimi togarashi, and nori.

recipes.title: Melon Pan
ingredients: a pinch of salt, for the topping
1tbsp matcha powder, optional for the topping
optional filling, such as chocolate or sweet red bean paste
method: Warm the cream on medium heat and dissolve 25g of the plain flour with a spatula.
Once homogeneous, add into the stand mixer bowl, together with the rest of the main dough ingredients.
Mix with the dough hook for 15mins, then cover and let rest for 1h.
Make the topping dough by creaming the butter and both sugars. Then add the egg white, vanilla, and salt.
Gently incorporate the flour, and refrigerate for 1h. Before using, knead with the dough hook for 5mins.
Divide the main dough into 5-6 balls, with the optional filling wrapped inside.
With floured hands, divide the topping dough and roll it out to lay it over the buns, tucking in the excess.
Let them proof for an extra 1h, and then score the tops with a criss-cross pattern using a knife.
Bake for 20mins at 175ºC.

recipes.title: Mapo Tofu
ingredients: 2 tbsp cornstarch, dissolved in a little water
method: Fry off the minced garlic and ginger in a mix of vegetable and chilli oil
Once fragrant, add the minced pork, and let it cook completely.
Add the Shaoxing wine and Doubanjiang, and stir well.
Add the chicken broth, and cut up the tofu into cubes while it simmers for a bit.
Mix in the cornstarch slurry and, once thickened, add the tofu, stirring carefully.
Add a bit more chilli oil and let it all cook for a further 5mins before serving.

recipes.title: Fudge
method: Place all the ingredients in a large non-stick pan.
Melt over low heat, until the sugar fully dissolves.
Bring to a steady boil for 10-15 mins, stirring continuously to prevent it from burning.
Remove from the heat and let cool for 5 mins.
Beat the mixture until it just looses it's shine and becomes very thick, for about 10 mins.
Press into a tin and leave to set before cutting up into cubes.

recipes.title: Ben's Cookies
method: Melt the butter in a bowl, and stir in the sugars and vanilla extract.
Making sure it's not to hot, crack the egg in and keep mixing.
Pour into a larger bowl, where the flour, baking powder, and salt has been mixed.
Stir well until fully combined. This will make a stiff dough.
Place one spoonful of dough on the baking sheet at a time, leaving plenty of room in between them.
Place the chocolate chips on each dough ball.
Bake at 180ºC for 10 mins.

recipes.title: Lemon Curd Tarts
method: For the tarts, mix the golden syrup and vegetable oil until combined.
Add the flour and baking powder, mix, and then knead by hand until the dough stops falling apart. Rest for 1h.
Divide the dough into 8 pieces, and line a muffin tray with the flattened dough.
Line each tart with some kitchen foil and pour some rice/beans on top to prevent the bottom from rising.
Bake at 200ºC for 10 mins, then for an extra 5 without the foil. Set aside.
For the curd, zest the lemons and blend the zest with the sugar until finely minced.
In a bowl, cream the room-temperature butter with the zest and sugar mixture.
Add the eggs, one at a time, and then the juice from the lemons. Mix well.
Pour the mixture into a pan, and cook over low heat until thickened.
Pour the curd into the tart shells and allow to cool fully before serving.

recipes.title: Carrot Cake
method: Whisk together the flour, baking powder, salt, and cinnamon.
In another bowl, mix together the oil and sugars. Add in eggs one at time and mix thoroughly.
Add flour mixture to wet ingredients in 2 portions, mixing inbetween.
Fold in carrots and pecans.
Pour into a lightly greased pan and bake at 175ºC for 50 mins, until a toothpick comes out clean from the middle.
Whisk the three icing incredients: cream cheese, icing sugar, and double cream.
Let the cake cool, cut in half vertically, then decorate with icing.

recipes.title: Pimientos Rellenos
method: Start cooking the onion sauce by thinly slicing the onion and garlic, and frying it off in some olive oil.
Once they're turning golden, add a heaped tbsp of flour and stir well.
Add the stock and bring to a boil for 5mins.
Blend the sauce in the pan, and leave on low heat to reduce.
In the meantime, cook the mince meat in a pan, stirring often to separate the chunks.
Once it's all cooked, add the tomato sauce, grated egg, and season with salt, pepper, and paprika.
Add a heaped tbsp of flour and stir until fully combined.
Incorporate the milk slowly, until the mixture has lightened in colour and cannot absorb any more.
Simmer for a couple more minutes, then set aside to cool.
Once cooled, stuff all the peppers to the brim with the meat filling.
Add the now-reduced onion sauce to the pan that has the excess filling, and place the stuffed peppers on top.
Simmer it all gently for 10-15mins.

recipes.title: Hong Shao Rou
method: Boil the pork for a couple of minutes to get rid of the scum.
Add the sugar to an empty pot, and cook until it starts melting.
Add the pork and coat it in the sugar until there's no more left.
Add all the rest of the ingredients.
Simmer for 1h covered, then for 10mins uncovered, or until the liquid has reduced entirely.
Remove the bay leaves, star anise, and cinnamon sticks before serving.

recipes.title: Japanese Cheesecake
ingredients: 3 eggs separated into whites and yolks
method: Melt the cheese, butter, and milk in a bowl using bain marie.
Remove from the heat, add the egg yolks and whisk together.
Sift in the flour and corn starch, and whish again.
In a separate bowl, whisk the egg whites to soft peaks, while adding the sugar slowly.
Add 1/3 of the egg whites into the other mixture and combine well.
Add the remaining egg whites gently, folding without over mixing or letting too much air out.
Pour into a pan, then place it in a trough with water 5cm high.
Bake for 1h at 120ºC, then for 15mins at 150ºC.
Remove from the pan and let cool before serving.

recipes.title: Taiwanese Beef Noodle Soup
ingredients: Chinese aromatics (2 star anise, 1/2 cinnamon stick, 1 tbsp Sichuan peppercorns, 1/2 tbsp each fennel, coriander and cumin seeds)
method: Boil the diced beef for 1min, then thoroughly rinse to remove impurities.
Saute the ginger, garlic, green onions and onion until the latter is translucent.
Add the tomato and dried chillies ripped in half.
Add the meat, tomato paste, doubanjiang, soy sauce, Shaoxing wine, and sugar. Mix thoroughly.
Pour 950ml of water into the pot, as well as all the spice aromatics.
Set the Instant Pot to 1h40mins on the stew setting (not venting), or simmer in a regular pot for 3h.
When that's done, release the IP valve
Boil the noodles, adding the bok choi to the pot for the final 2 mins.
Pour the soup over the noodles and serve with coriander and picked mustard greens.

recipes.title: Matcha Brownies
method: Melt the white chocolate and the butter together in a bain-marie.
Add the sugar, then the eggs one by one, stirring until smooth in between.
Add the matcha, flour, baking powder, and salt, mixing until completely distributed.
Stir in the chopped white chocolate, and spread the mixture onto a greased tray.
Bake for 12mins at 180ºC.
Let cool in the refrigerator before serving.

recipes.title: Salmorejo Cordobes
method: Blend the diced tomatoes to a fine soup.
Strain the soup into a bowl, and let the bread soak in it for at least 10mins.
Blend the soup with the bread together with the peeled garlic cloves and the olive oil. It should turn orange after a while.
Season and refrigerate well before serving.

recipes.title: Tortilla de Patatas
method: Peel, wash, dry, and thinly slice the potatoes.
Place in a bowl with salt.
Heat up the olive oil in a deep pan, and cook the potatoes for about 20mins. They should be slightly golden.
Scoop up the potatoes with as little oil as possible and place them into the bowl with the beaten eggs.
Once mixed through and seasoned, pour the mixture in a small round pan with a little of the leftover oil.
Cook for about 3mins each side, using a plate to help flip the tortilla.

recipes.title: Black Bean Chilli Stir-Fry
ingredients: 2tbsp Lao Gan Ma black beans in chilli oil
method: Add all the sauce ingredients in a bowl and mix them well.
Stir fry the veggies while the noodles cook.
Once, the veggies are done, add the noodles in.
When that's all combined, add the sauce mix and mix it through.

recipes.title: Bacalao Ajoarriero
method: Chop the peppers, potato, and onions into small cubes, and mince the garlic.
Shred the cod fillets as finely as possible.
Fry the garlic in plenty of olive oil, and add the rest of the vegetables when it starts to turn golden.
Cook for 15mins, then add the cod.
Keep frying until the cod is pretty much done, then add the tomatoes.
Mix thoroughly and season with the salt, pepper, and paprika.

recipes.title: Green Onion Pancakes
method: Add all the ingredients in a bowl - including the minced garlic and chopped green onions.
Mix well.
Oil a non-stick pan and cook a ladle-full of the batter at a time.
Try to flatten the batter as much as possible.
Cook for ~3mins each side or until golden brown.
Serve with a soy sauce and black vinegar dip.

recipes.title: Gazpacho
method: Blend all the ingredients together with some water.
Let cool in the fridge before serving.

recipes.title: Japanese Curry
method: Chop all the vegetables into small cubes.
Stir fry the vegetables with the protein for about 5mins in some vegetable oil.
Add the water and let it simmer for 15mins.
Add the curry cubes and stir them in well.
Let it simmer for another 5mins.
Serve on rice or noodles.

recipes.title: Matcha Shortbread
method: Sift the matcha powder and flour into a bowl.
With a hand mixer, beat the softened butter until creamy.
Add a pinch of salt and the sugar, and keep mixing until light.
Add the egg yolks and continue mixing.
Slowly incorporate the flour mixture while still mixing, until a smooth dough is formed.
Add the blitzed white chocolate to the dough.
Shape the dough into a cilinder, cling-wrap tight and store in the fridge for at least 2h (preferably overnight).
Once cold, cut into 1cm thick cookies.
Bake for 15mins at 150ºC fan. Let cool.

recipes.title: Pork and Butterbean Cassoulet
method: Fry off the medallions in some olive oil until brown (but not cooked through), set aside.
In the resulting oil, fry the chopped shallots, mushrooms, and garlic.
After 3-4mins, add the strained beans, as well as the flour, and mix well.
Slowly incorporate the stock, making sure it's well combined before adding more.
Once it's simmering, add the pork back in, cover, and simmer for 10mins.
Finally, add the cream and spinach. Serve once the latter has wilted.

recipes.title: Gooey Brownies
method: Melt the dark chocolate and butter in a bain marie, leave to cool.
Sift the flour, baking powder, and cocoa powder into a bowl.
Whisk the eggs and sugar until pale and double in size.
Getly fold the melted chocolate mixture into the egg mousse.
Sift the dry ingredients into the mix and fold gently.
Stir in the chopped white and dark chocolate chunks.
Pour the brownie mixture into a greased tin.
Cook for 20 mins at 160ºC fan, until the centre isn't wobbly.
Set aside to cool before serving.

recipes.title: Cocido Madrileño
method: Boil the meat and bones for 10 mins and remove the generated scum. Drain.
Add all the ingredients in a large pot with enough water to cover them all.
Simmer for 3h.
Add the short noodles for the final 10 mins.
After removing from the heat, take the meats out, chop them roughly, and add them back in.
Stir through and serve.

recipes.title: Baileys Cheesecake
method: Remove the filling from the oreos and set aside
Blitz the oreo cookies and mix with the melted butter
Pat a layer of the cookie mix into each container, and chill
While it is chilling, melt the chocolate.
In a bowl, whip the cream until it forms soft peaks.
In a separate bowl, beat the cream cheese until it is soft.
Fold in the whipped cream, Bailey's and three-quarters of the chocolate.
When the mixture is smooth, pour it evenly onto the biscuit base.
Smooth the remaining chocolate on top of the cheesecake mixture.
Refridgerate and allow to set for at least 2h, preferably overnight.

recipes.title: Ensaladilla Rusa
method: Boil the peeled potatoes and carrots for 25 mins.
Add the eggs and some salt to the boiling water.
Drain everything out, and chop into small cubes once cooled.
Mix it all in a bowl with the tuna, chopped olives, peas, and mayo
Season to taste with salt and parsley

recipes.title: Tomato and Egg-drop Soup
method: Chop the green onion and seperate whites from greens.
Smash and mince the garlic and chop the tomatoes.
Heat up oil in a pot and fry the white parts of the green onion until soft, then add the garlic.
Get it nice and warm then add the tomatoes, salt, sugar, and white pepper.
Cook until the tomatoes have released liquid and are soft, then add chicken broth.
Once it's boiling again, add the noodles into the soup.
1 min before the noodles are done, reduce heat on the soup and add the whisked egg.
Top with the green part of the green onion and chili oil

recipes.title: Sichuan-style Green Beans
method: Dry fry the green beans in a wok wihout oil until soft and slightly charred, like 20 mins.
Set the beans aside.
Cook the minced pork and chopped garlic in a bit of sesame oil until it starts turning brown.
Add the spicy broadbean paste, the Shaosing wine, and soy sauce, cook until combined.
Turn the heat off and add the beans back in.
Mix and serve with rice.

recipes.title: Slow Beef Ragu
ingredients: Plenty of salt, pepper, olive oil and parsley
method: Cut the beef into 4-6 smaller chunks. Sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Sear the beef on all sides until slightly bronwed and set aside.
Re-oil the pan and sauté the diced onions and minced garlic.
Add the diced carrot and celery and sauté for a further 5 mins.
Add all the remaining ingredients in the pot and put the beef back too.
Cover and simmer for 2h.
Remove the beef and shred with 2 forks. Return the shredded beef to the pot.
Continue simmering without a lid for 30mins.
Taste and adjust seasoning as appropriate.
Serve as sauce with pasta and parmesan on top.

recipes.title: Chicken Bulgogi Udon
method: Thinly slice the chicken breasts and put them in a bowl with the soy sauce, mirin, sugar, sesame oil, pepper, and grated ginger and garlic.
Let marinate for at least 10 mins.
Run the udon noodles under hot tap water to loosen them, rinse in cold water, drain, and set aside.
Heat a large pan with sesame oil and cook the sliced onion until soft and golden.
Add the marinated chicken and stir fry until the chicken is cooked.
Add the noodles and stir fry together some more.
Add the chopped green onions.
Serve with sesame oil and sesame seeds.

recipes.title: Broccoli and Beef in Oyster Sauce
method: Cut the trees out of the broccoli head and boil for 3-4mins.
Fry the chopped garlic in sesame oil.
Add the thinly sliced steak and continue to stir-fry.
Once it's almost cooked through, add a good amount of oyster sauce and a bit of water.
Add the boiled broccoli and let the sauce thicken (cornflour can help).
Serve with rice.

recipes.title: Pisto Manchego
method: Cook the crushed and finely chopped garlic in plenty of olive oil. Never stop stirring.
Add the chopped onion and peppers. Cook until softened (adding salt to help).
Add the chopped courgette and poach everything until soft.
Add the tomatoes, peeled and de-seeded. Once they're soft you can chop them with your tongs/spatula.
Once all the veggies are done, add a bit of tomato sauce. Stir until hot throughout.
Serve with eggs in any form (fried, poached, omelet...).

recipes.title: Veggie Tikka Masala
ingredients: 500ml of prepared Tikka Masala sauce (by Sainsbury's - 1 bottle)
method: Cut the cauliflower into small bite-sized florets and wash.
Chop and microwave the carrot for 2-3 mins to soften them.
Cut the onions into thin strips.
Cook the cauliflower, onions, carrot, cubed panner, garlic and ginger all together in a big pot with plenty of oil.
Once the onions are soft and almost transparent, add the tikka masala sauce, tomato paste, and extra water to cover all the ingredients.
Cover and let cook for 10-15 mins.
Remove the cover and add the cornflower and extra spices to taste.
Cook for a little longer until it has the desired thickness.
Serve with rice or naan.

recipes.title: Kimchi Fried Rice
method: Squeeze all the juice out of the kimchi and set aside.
Chop the now dry kimchi, as well as the onion and garlic.
Mix the gochujang and soy sauce with the kimchi juice.
Drizzle the sesame oil into the coocked rice.
Stir fry the onions and garlic, one softened add the kimchi too.
Add the rice and stir well to avoid clumps.
Add the sauce mix in and stir fry for a while longer.
Add the eggs, and cook them in with the residual heat.
Serve with the chopped green onion on top.

recipes.title: Chicken Pesto and Courgette Pasta
method: With a vegetable peeler, shave ribbons of the zucchini until you reach the seeds.
Fry off the chicken cut into strips/chunks.
Once the chicken is fully cooked, add the pesto, some more olive oil and the courgette ribbons.
Reduce the heat, add the cheese, and stir until all is warm through.

recipes.title: Chicken Udon Soup
ingredients: 2 portions of udon noodles (frozen or dry)
method: Make the dashi broth (mix 3 teaspoons of powder with 1L of water).
Add the soy sauce, mirin and sugar to the stock. Let boil for 2-3 mins.
Cut the leek length-wise and clean between the leaves. Cut length-wise again and then into 5cm pieces.
Cut the chicken into bite-sized pieces
Add the leek, chicken, and sake to the soup.
Bring the soup back to a boil, then cook until the chicken is fully cooked and the leek is tender.
If the noodles are not fresh, cook separately as the chicken is cooking and then add. If they're fresh, add them directly to the soup now.
Sprinkle chopped green onion and serve.

recipes.title: Carrot Falafels
method: Drain the chickpeas with a tea towel.
Peel and thinly cut the carrots.
Place all ingredients in a food processor and blend together to form a paste.
Form paste into small balls.
Fry off in a pan with oil.

recipes.title: Caramelised Onions
method: Chop all the onions into half-rings.
Heat the oil in a large pan and slowly cook the onions with some salt until they're soft.
Add the sugar and vinegar and cook further until fully caramelised.

recipes.title: Nametake
method: Cut off the brown end of the Enoki mushrooms and wash.
Put in a pot all the ingredients except the vinegar and cook at medium heat, stirring constantly.
When thickened, add the vinegar and cook 2-3 minutes longer.
Remove from heat, and let cool.

recipes.title: Soy-Glazed Salmon
method: Mix everything (except the salmon) to make the sauce.
Coat salmon in sauce (keep excess in oven dish) and cook for 15-20 mins at 200ºC.

recipes.title: German Salad
method: Boil the diced potatoes in salty water for 30 mins. Salt and pepper them.
Finely chop the onion and add to the potatoes.
Fry off the sausages for a couple of minutes, then chop and add.
Mix the mayo, mustard and parsley. Add.
